Trial_Design.evidence: A priori power analysis suggested that 34 legs were required to achieve statistical significance of 0.05 with 80% of power to detect a 50% difference in treatment effect between treatment and control groups.

Participants.evidence: Between April 2010 and January 2011, we evaluated 36 patients undergoing bilateral tibia lengthening who met prespecified inclusion criteria.

Intervention.evidence: BtX-A (200 IU) was injected at the calf muscle only in one leg for each patient and the same amount of sterile normal saline was injected into the other leg as a control.

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized that it may decrease calf pain and increase ROM of the surrounding joints by reducing muscle stiffness.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Clinical evaluation included a VAS score for calf pain and measurement of ROM of the knees and ankles and calf circumference, with evaluations performed in a double-blinded manner.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Selection of the leg receiving the toxin was randomized.

Blinding.evidence: with evaluations performed in a double-blinded manner.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between April 2010 and January 2011, we evaluated 36 patients undergoing bilateral tibia lengthening who met prespecified inclusion criteria.

Result_Outcome.evidence: There were no differences in calf pain, knee and ankle ROM, and maximal calf circumferences between the two legs at each time point.
